item.description: Agency Assist; INC#1396; 07:12PM; 4730 N Crystal Springs Dr; MAP: https://bit.ly/3K0gh2G; Griffith Park; Park Rangers requested LAFD assistance for a body recovery at or near Griffith Park. Due to the location and light conditions, the Incident Commander has determined a "short haul" hoist will be the best course of action to relocate the victim for law enforcement and Coroner to continue their investigations. ; FS 56; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 4; BC5 E227 E27 E56 E90 H1 HA1 T27 UR27; CH7; 13; Nicholas Prange

Hiker Rescue; INC#0816; 01:07PM; 7193 W Mulholland Dr; MAP: https://bit.ly/38bH12d; Hollywood Hills; One injured adult male hiker (in fair condition) has been safely hoisted from his remote location by LAFD Air Ops and taken to a local hospital.; FS 76; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 4; AO1 AO2 BC5 E227 E290 E97 H1 H6 HA1 HA6 HH97 RA97 RH114 T27 T90; CH7; 13; Nicholas Prange

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#1173; 04:28PM; 320 S Coronado St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3Nx6gw9; Westlake; KNOCKDOWN: 45 firefighters extinguished the fire in 28 minutes with no injuries reported. The fire extended into the attic but was contained to the unit of origin. All occupants were out of the unit prior to LAFD arrival and one adult female was evaluated but she declined transport. The Incident Commander requested LAFD Arson for the investigation. No further details.; FS 11; Batt 11; Central Bureau; Council District 1; BC11 BC5 E11 E13 E20 E203 E211 E220 E6 EM11 RA11 RA6 RA811 SQ21 T11 T20 T3; CH9; 13; Margaret Stewart

Structure Fire; INC#1173; 04:00PM; 320 S Coronado St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3Nx6gw9; Westlake; Two story, four-plex with fire showing from one unit on the 2nd floor. Firefighters are in the offensive mode.; FS 11; Batt 11; Central Bureau; Council District 1; BC11 BC5 E13 E20 E203 E211 E220 E6 RA11 RA811 SQ21 T11 T20 T3; CH9; 13; Margaret Stewart

Long Fall ; INC#0960; 01:43PM; 1440 S Sepulveda Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3wMVxb2; Westwood; A male patient fell approximately 30' from scaffolding atop the roof (fell to the roof). Firefighters have secured him to a backboard and are establishing a litter basket operation to safely bring him to the ground and hospital transport. Age/condition and extent of injuries unknown at this time. No further details.; FS 37; Batt 9; West Bureau; Council District 5; E37 RA59 T37; CH4; 13; Margaret Stewart

Update Trapped Vehicle; INC#1714; 11:32PM; 1330 W Harry Bridges Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3gQQFcU; Wilmington; Both patients are out of the passenger vehicle (the semi-trailer driver was not injured) and one patient, 30yo male, is declining transportation. The 30yo female patient is being transported in *at least* serious condition given the mechanism of injury. Any media questions are referred to CHP Log# 3346. No further details.; FS 49; Batt 6; South Bureau; Council District 15; BC6 E238 E36 E38 E49 EM13 HR3 RA36 RA38 T38; CH7; 13; Margaret Stewart

Trapped Vehicle; INC#1714; 11:18PM; 1330 W Harry Bridges Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3gQQFcU; Wilmington; Collision of one vehicle and a semi-trailer with two patients in critical condition. One patient requires extrication. CHP Log# 3346; FS 49; Batt 6; South Bureau; Council District 15; BC6 E238 E36 E38 E49 EM13 HR3 RA36 RA38 T38; CH7; 13; Margaret Stewart

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#1556; 09:50PM; 13281 W Van Nuys Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3JLg837; Pacoima; KNOCKDOWN: Over 70 firefighters extinguished the fire in 42 minutes with no injuries reported. During an aggressive roof operation by truck companies, firefighters cut a ventilation strip to help prevent the horizontal spread of fire to adjoining units. LAFD Arson is responding, per protocol, for the investigation. Some resources will be released shortly but crews will be on scene for an extended duration for overhaul and the investigation. LAFD PIO CPT Weireter is on scene for media availability.; FS 98; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; BC10 BC12 BC15 CM42 E24 E274 E287 E288 E289 E290 E298 E7 E88 E89 E90 E93 EA1 EM14 EM15 PI3 RA7 RA75 RA898 RA98 T74 T87 T88 T89 T90 T98 UR89; CH9; 17 18; Margaret Stewart

Update Structure Fire; INC#1556; 09:37PM; 13281 W Van Nuys Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3JLg837; Pacoima; After a transitional attack to knock back some of the blaze, firefighters are now resuming an offensive operation and moving in for an interior attack. There were reports of a possible person inside the fire unit but the individual was located outside and unharmed. Part of the roof is burned through over the original fire unit. Truck companies are on the adjacent roofs working to prevent the horizontal spread of fire to the other businesses. Additional crews are performing salvage operations inside the units to protect the contents from smoke/water damage. There are no injuries reported. Please avoid the area of Van Nuys Blvd between El Dorado Ave and Telfair due to the large number of fire apparatus and large diameter water supply lines in the street.; FS 98; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; BC10 BC12 BC15 CM42 E24 E274 E287 E288 E289 E290 E7 E88 E89 E90 EA1 EM14 EM15 PI3 RA7 RA75 RA898 RA98 T74 T87 T88 T89 T90 UR89; CH9; 17 18; Margaret Stewart

Update Structure Fire; INC#1556; 09:23PM; 13281 W Van Nuys Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3JLg837; Pacoima; This incident is at the Greater Alarm status. Heavy fire appears to be in at least two of the commercial units. Firefighters are in the offensive mode but given the current conditions they are moving out of the structure to deploy a transitional attack. They will hit the fire from the exterior to improve conditions for a renewed interior fire attack. LAFD PIO Captain Cody Weireter is enroute for media availability. ; FS 98; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; BC10 BC12 BC15 CM42 E24 E274 E287 E288 E289 E290 E7 E88 E89 E90 EM15 RA898 RA98 T74 T87 T88 T89 T90 UR89; CH9; 17 18; Margaret Stewart
